body_html:
It was not in the x86 folder either. Nsight was not an option when installing CUDA. Did you possibly mean visual studio integration? Just tried that and the installer failed.

After a little more research, it seems that I need to install both Visual Studio 2017, and the Nsight IDE to be able to build pytorch. Currently I only have C++ build tools and CUDA/cudnn, which I thought was sufficient since it is all that is needed to build tensorflow.
body_text:
It was not in the x86 folder either. Nsight was not an option when installing CUDA. Did you possibly mean visual studio integration? Just tried that and the installer failed.
After a little more research, it seems that I need to install both Visual Studio 2017, and the Nsight IDE to be able to build pytorch. Currently I only have C++ build tools and CUDA/cudnn, which I thought was sufficient since it is all that is needed to build tensorflow.
body:
It was not in the x86 folder either. Nsight was not an option when installing CUDA. Did you possibly mean visual studio integration? Just tried that and the installer failed.

After a little more research, it seems that I need to install both Visual Studio 2017, and the Nsight IDE to be able to build pytorch. Currently I only have C++ build tools and CUDA/cudnn, which I thought was sufficient since it is all that is needed to build tensorflow.
